metadata.title: CVE-2013-0236 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in WordPress before3.5.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML viavectors involving (1) gallery shortcodes or (2) the content of a post.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0236` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-l10n - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 3.5.1+dfsg-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.5.1+dfsg-2').
